name: Caffeine Molecule
description: Caffeine is a xanthine alkaloid compound that temporarily wards off drowsiness and restores alertness in humans.
Caffeine is sometimes called guaranine when found in guarana, mateine when found in mate, and theine when found in tea.
It is found in the leaves and beans of the coffee plant, in tea, yerba mate, and guarana berries, and in small quantities in cocoa, the kola nut and the Yaupon Holly.

annotations.label: Dipole-Dipole Forces
description: This point is the negative charged side of the molecule.

annotations.label: London Dispersion Forces
description: Caffiene exhibits strong London Dispersion forces.

This makes it difficult to break the molecule apart, therefore more energy is needed causing a high melting and boiling point. The Melting point is 235 degrees Celsius and the boiling point is 178 degrees Celsius.
